member.name: T:PatternRecognition.FingerprintRecognition.Experiments.FVC2004_DB4_B
member.summary: Allows testing a fingerprint matching algorithm in database DB4_B from FVC2004.

remarks.para: The performance indicators computed in this experiments are: EER(%), FMR100(%), FMR1000(%), ZeroFMR(%), Time(ms) and ROC curves. This indicators are saved in a file which name is formed by the name of the matching algorithm concatenated with ".Summary.csv". This file is saved in a folder by the name of "Results" in the same folder where the fingerprints are stored. Two more files are saved, one file containing the false matching fingerprints and the other containing the false not matching fingerprints.
In order to execute the experiment, you must set the properties , and . Optionally, you can set the property in order to get updates concerning the status of the experiment.

member.name: T:PatternRecognition.FingerprintRecognition.Experiments.FVC2004_DB4_A
member.summary: Allows testing a fingerprint matching algorithm in database DB4_A from FVC2004.

remarks.para: This experiment uses the evaluation protocol of the Fingerprint Verification Competitions [1]. The performance indicators computed in this experiments are: EER(%), FMR100(%), FMR1000(%), ZeroFMR(%), Time(ms) and ROC curves. This indicators are saved in a file which name is formed by the name of the matching algorithm concatenated with ".Summary.csv". This file is saved in a folder by the name of "Results" in the same folder where the fingerprints are stored. Two more files are saved, one file containing the false fingerprint matches and the other containing the false not matches.
In order to execute the experiment, you must set the properties , and . Optionally, you can set the property in order to get updates concerning the status of the experiment.
References:

list.item: R. Cappelli, D. Maio, D. Maltoni, J. L. Wayman, and A. K. Jain, "Performance evaluation of fingerprint verification systems," IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, vol. 28, pp. 3-18, 2006.

member.name: T:PatternRecognition.FingerprintRecognition.Experiments.FVC2004_DB_A
member.summary: Abstract class containing the evaluation protocol for testing a fingerprint matching algorithm in databases DB1_A, DB2_A, DB3_A and DB4_A from FVC2004.

remarks.para: This experiment uses the evaluation protocol of the Fingerprint Verification Competitions [1]. The performance indicators computed in this experiments are: EER(%), FMR100(%), FMR1000(%), ZeroFMR(%), Time(ms) and ROC curves. This indicators are saved in a file which name is formed by the name of the matching algorithm concatenated with ".Summary.csv". This file is saved in a folder by the name of "Results" in the same folder where the fingerprints are stored. Two more files are saved, one file containing the false fingerprint matches and the other containing the false not matches.
In order to execute the experiment, you must set the properties , and . Optionally, you can set the property in order to get updates concerning the status of the experiment.
References:

list.item: R. Cappelli, D. Maio, D. Maltoni, J. L. Wayman, and A. K. Jain, "Performance evaluation of fingerprint verification systems," IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, vol. 28, pp. 3-18, 2006.

member.summary: The matcher to be evaluated.

member.name: T:PatternRecognition.FingerprintRecognition.Experiments.FVC_DB_B
member.summary: Abstract class containing an evaluation protocol for testing a fingerprint matching algorithm in databases DB1_B, DB2_B, DB3_B and DB4_B from FVC2000, FVC2002 and FVC2004.

remarks.para: The performance indicators computed in this experiments are: EER(%), FMR100(%), FMR1000(%), ZeroFMR(%), Time(ms) and ROC curves. This indicators are saved in a file which name is formed by the name of the matching algorithm concatenated with ".Summary.csv". This file is saved in a folder by the name of "Results" in the same folder where the fingerprints are stored. Two more files are saved, one file containing the false matching fingerprints and the other containing the false not matching fingerprints.
In order to execute the experiment, you must set the properties , and . Optionally, you can set the property in order to get updates concerning the status of the experiment.
